entries: The juggernaut recharges Deadly Shaping and uses it.

monsters.name: Relentless Slasher

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the slasher fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Shrouded Presence
entries: The slasher is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, and it can't be detected by abilities that sense Fiends.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The slasher makes two Slasher's Knife attacks.

actions.name: Slasher's Knife
entries: mw,rw 7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it suffers a lingering wound that causes it to take 7 (2d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. Each time the slasher hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 3 (1d6). The wound ends if the target regains hit points or if a creature uses an action to stanch the wound, which requires a successful 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check.

monsters.languages: understands all languages but can't speak

legendary.name: Slice
entries: mw,rw 7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Vanishing Strike (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The slasher makes one Slasher's Knife attack. After the attack hits or misses, the slasher can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Stirge Telepathy
entries: The strigoi can magically command any stirge within 120 feet of it, using a limited form of telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The strigoi makes one Claw attack and makes one Proboscis attack.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 6 (1d12) acid damage.

actions.name: Proboscis
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and the strigoi regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. A creature reduced to 0 hit points from this attack dies and leaves nothing behind except its skin and its equipment.

actions.name: Ravenous Children (1/Day)
entries: The strigoi magically summons 1d4 + 2 stirge||stirges (see their entry in the Monster Manual) in unoccupied spaces it can see within 30 feet of it. The stirges are under the strigoi's control and act immediately after the strigoi in the initiative order. The stirges disappear after 1 hour, when the strigoi dies, or when the strigoi dismisses them (no action required).

traits.name: Limited Spell Immunity
entries: The swarm automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of 3rd level or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells always miss it.

traits.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny gremishka. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Bites
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

traits.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny maggot. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Infestation
entries: mw 3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. A creature damaged by the swarm must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or contract a disease.
Each time the diseased creature finishes a long rest, roll a d6 to determine the disease's effect:

{"type":"list","style":"list-hang-notitle","items":[{"type":"item","name":"1-2","entries":["The creature is blinded until it finishes a long rest."]},{"type":"item","name":"3-4","entries":["The creature's hit point maximum decreases by 5 (2d4), and the reduction can't be removed until the disease ends. The creature dies if its hit point maximum drops to 0."]},{"type":"item","name":"5-6","entries":["The creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until it finishes its next long rest.","The disease lasts until it's removed by magic or until the creature rolls the same random effect for the disease two long rests in a row."]}]}

traits.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny scarab. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

traits.name: Skeletonize
entries: If the swarm starts its turn in the same space as a dead creature that is Large or smaller, the corpse is destroyed, leaving behind only equipment and bones (or exoskeleton).

traits.name: Spider Climb
entries: The swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Ravenous Bites
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. If the target is a creature, scarabs burrow into its body, and the creature takes 3 (1d6) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. Any creature can use an action to kill or remove the scarabs with fire or a weapon that deals piercing damage, causing 1 damage of the appropriate type to the target. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the swarm's piercing damage dies.

monsters.name: Swarm of Zombie Limbs

traits.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny limb. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The swarm doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes one Undead Mass attack and one Grasping Limbs attack.

actions.name: Undead Mass
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

actions.name: Grasping Limbs
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. 7 (2d6) necrotic damage, and the creature must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be restrained. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, taking 7 (2d6) necrotic damage on a failed save. The creature is freed if it succeeds on this saving throw, the swarm moves out of the creature's space, or the swarm dies.

monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 9

traits.name: Formed by the Mists
entries: When created, the horror's body composition takes one of four forms: Aberrant Armor, Loathsome Limbs, Malleable Mass, or Oozing Organs. This form determines certain traits in this stat block.

traits.name: Amorphous (Malleable Mass Only)
entries: The horror can move through any opening at least 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Bile Body (Oozing Organs Only)
entries: Any creature that touches the horror or hits it with a melee attack takes 5 (1d10) acid damage.

traits.name: Relentless Stride (Loathsome Limbs Only)
entries: The horror can move through the space of another creature. The first time on a turn that the horror enters a creature's space during this move, the creature must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The horror makes two Limbs attacks.

actions.name: Limbs
entries: mw 8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Hex Blast 5
entries: The horror expels necrotic energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (7d12) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Vampiric Mind Flayer

traits.name: Spider Climb
entries: The mind flayer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the mind flayer has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The mind flayer doesn't require air, food, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The mind flayer makes two Claw attacks or one Claw attack and one Tentacles attack.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Tentacles
entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape 15).

actions.name: Drink Sapience
entries: The mind flayer targets one creature it is grappling. The target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 14 (4d6) psychic damage and gain 1 level of exhaustion. The mind flayer regains a number of hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the psychic damage dies.

monsters.languages: telepathy 120 ft. but can only project emotions

traits.name: Shapechanger
entries: The wereraven can use its action to polymorph into a raven-humanoid hybrid or into a raven, or back into its human form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its human form if it dies.

traits.name: Mimicry
entries: The wereraven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

traits.name: Regeneration
entries: The wereraven regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the wereraven takes damage from a silvered weapon or a spell, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wereraven's next turn. The wereraven dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The wereraven makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with its hand crossbow.

actions.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage in raven form, or 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.

actions.name: Shortsword (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: rw 4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Zombie Clot

traits.name: Deathly Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or take 9 (2d8) poison damage and be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
entries: mw 8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Flesh Entomb 5
entries: The zombie flings a detached clump of corpses at a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or take 16 (3d10) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it becomes entombed in dead flesh.

A creature entombed in the dead flesh is restrained, has Cover||3||total cover against attacks and other effects outside the dead flesh, and takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can be freed if the dead flesh is destroyed. The dead flesh is a Large object with AC 10, 25 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

monsters.name: Zombie Plague Spreader

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Viral Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the plague spreader must make a 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned and can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this plague spreader's Viral Aura for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The plague spreader makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Virulent Miasma (1/Day)
entries: The plague spreader releases toxic gas in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies and rises as a zombie (see its stat block in the Monster Manual) 1 minute later. The zombie acts immediately after the plague spreader in the initiative count.

monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

monsters.name: Adult Amethyst Dragon
monsters.speed: walk 40 ft., fly [object Object] ft., swim 40 ft.

traits.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (1d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Singularity Breath 5
entries: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 20 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 45 (10d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 23

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The dragon makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Explosive Crystal (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The dragon spits an amethyst that that explodes at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (3d8) force damage and be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Adult Crystal Dragon
monsters.speed: walk 40 ft., fly 80 ft., burrow 40 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Scintillating Breath 5
entries: The dragon exhales a burst of brilliant radiance in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 40 (9d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon then gains 15 temporary hit points by absorbing a portion of the radiant energy.

monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 20

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The dragon makes one Claw attack.

legendary.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Starlight Strike (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The dragon releases a searing beam of starlight at a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 31 (9d6) radiant damage.

monsters.name: Adult Deep Dragon
monsters.speed: walk 40 ft., fly 80 ft., swim 40 ft., burrow 30 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
entries: mw 9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

actions.name: Nightmare Breath 5
entries: The dragon exhales a cloud of spores in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 33 (6d10) psychic damage, and it is frightened of the dragon for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 150 ft., passive Perception 17

legendary.name: Commanding Spores
entries: The dragon releases spores around a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see. The target must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, or the target can't take a reaction, it takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: The dragon makes one Tail attack.

legendary.name: Spore Salvo (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon releases poisonous spores around a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see. The target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or take 17 (5d6) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Adult Emerald Dragon
monsters.speed: walk 40 ft., fly 80 ft., burrow 30 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Shift Perception (1/Day)
entries: The dragon can cast hallucinatory terrain, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17).

traits.name: Tunneler

monsters.speed: walk 30 ft., fly [object Object] ft., swim 30 ft.

traits.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

actions.name: Bite

actions.name: Singularity Breath 5
entries: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (5d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 15

monsters.name: Amethyst Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: walk 60 ft., fly [object Object] ft., swim 60 ft., burrow 60 ft.

traits.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 19) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Breath Weapon 5
entries: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Claw attack.

legendary.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm emits a beam of psychic energy in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

actions.name: Nightmare Breath 5
entries: The dragon exhales a cloud of spores in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 49 (9d10) psychic damage, and it is frightened of the dragon for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. If no creatures are within reach, or the target can't take a reaction, it takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries: If the dragon turtle would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 350 hit points, and it recharges its Steam Breath. Additionally, the dragon turtle can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 62,000 XP (124,000 XP total) for defeating the dragon turtle after its Blessing of the Sea activates.

entries: The dragon turtle exhales steam in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 24 Constitution saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

entries: The dragon turtle moves up to its speed. If the dragon turtle is swimming, this movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

entries: The dragon turtle radiates intense heat. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

traits.name: Chromatic Form
entries: When created, the animated breath takes one of five forms, matching its creator's breath weapon: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. This form determines the creature's AC, damage resistance, traits, and attacks.

traits.name: Fire Aura (Fire Form Only)
entries: At the start of each of the animated breath's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the animated breath or hits it with a melee attack takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Putrid Aura (Acid and Poison Forms Only)
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the animated breath must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. A creature that touches the animated breath or hits it with a melee attack takes 3 (1d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The animated breath makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) damage of a type determined by the animated breath's form: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) radiant damage.

actions.name: Scintillating Breath 5
entries: The dragon exhales a burst of brilliant radiance in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon then gains 5 temporary hit points by absorbing a portion of the radiant energy.

monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15

monsters.name: Crystal Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: walk 60 ft., fly [object Object] ft., swim 60 ft., burrow 60 ft.

traits.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 19) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Breath Weapon 5
entries: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Claw attack.

legendary.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm emits a beam of psychic energy in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Deep Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.speed: walk 30 ft., fly 60 ft., swim 30 ft., burrow 15 ft.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Nightmare Breath 5
entries: The dragon exhales a cloud of spores in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage, and it is frightened of the dragon for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 90 ft., passive Perception 13

monsters.name: Dracohydra
monsters.speed: walk 30 ft., fly 30 ft., swim 30 ft.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The dracohydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the dracohydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.
Whenever the dracohydra takes 30 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the dracohydra dies.

At the end of its turn, the dracohydra grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken radiant damage since its last turn. The dracohydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown this way.

traits.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the dracohydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Wakeful
entries: While the dracohydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dracohydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

actions.name: Prismatic Breath 4
entries: The dracohydra's heads exhale a single breath of multicolored energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 33 (6d10) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
entries: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it bursts into flames and is reduced to ashes. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the draconian must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The draconian makes two Serrated Sword attacks and one Tail attack.

actions.name: Serrated Sword
entries: mw 6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
entries: mw 6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Controlled Fall
entries: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
entries: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its body turns to stone and releases a petrifying gas. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends; otherwise the creature is petrified for 1 minute. After 1 minute, the body of the draconian crumbles to dust.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The draconian makes two Shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
entries: mw 3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
entries: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into a puddle of acid and splashes acid on those around it. Each creature within 5 feet of the draconian must succeed on a 12 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Glide
entries: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The draconian makes two Dagger attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of the target's next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed.

actions.name: Dagger
entries: mw,rw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
entries: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its scales and flesh immediately shrivel away and its bones explode. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 9 (2d8) force damage.

traits.name: Glide
entries: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to 2 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it descends.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The draconian makes two Trident or Necrotic Ray attacks.

actions.name: Trident
entries: mw,rw 4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Necrotic Ray
entries: rs 4 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

traits.name: Death Throes
entries: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its magical essence lashes out as a ball of lightning at the closest creature within 30 feet of it before arcing out to up to two other creatures within 15 feet of the first. Each creature must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The draconian makes three Rend or Energy Ray attacks.

actions.name: Rend
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Energy Ray
entries: rs 6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Noxious Breath 5
entries: The draconian exhales a 15-foot cone of noxious gas. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 21 (6d6) poison damage and gains 1 level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, doesn't gain exhaustion, and is immune to all draconians' Noxious Breath for 24 hours.

monsters.name: Draconic Shard

traits.name: Deflection
entries: The shard's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The shard can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain||3. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 5 (1d10) force damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the shard fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points, the shard disappears and leaves a Tiny cracked gemstone in its space. The gemstone matches the kind of gem dragon it was in life and has AC 20, 15 hit points, and immunity to all damage except force. Unless the gemstone is destroyed, after 1d20 days, the gemstone dissipates and the shard re-forms, regaining all its hit points and appearing in the place the gemstone once occupied or in the nearest unoccupied space.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The shard doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The shard makes two Telekinetic Rend attacks.

actions.name: Telekinetic Rend
entries: ms,rs 12 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) force damage.

actions.name: Inhabit Object
entries: The shard disappears as it pours its psychic essence into a Medium or smaller nonsentient object it can see within 30 feet of it, magically possessing it. The object uses the shard's AC, and any damage dealt to the object applies to the shard's hit points. The shard inhabits the object until it uses an action to leave; until it is turned; until it is reduced to 0 hit points; or until an effect that ends possession, such as a dispel evil and good spell, is used on it. When it leaves the object, it reappears in the nearest unoccupied space.

While inhabited, the object becomes a magic item if it wasn't already, and a Tiny cracked gemstone matching the kind of gem dragon the shard was in life appears somewhere on the object. The shard can cause the object to fly using the shard's own flying speed, use its senses, speak verbally or telepathically, cast spells, and use its legendary actions.
If a creature wears or carries the inhabited object, the shard can grant the creature the following benefits:
Each of the creature's attacks deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit.
The creature gains resistance to psychic damage.

actions.name: Psychic Crush 5
entries: The shard unleashes a pulse of psychic power. Each creature of the shard's choice in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on it must make a 20 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 55 (10d10) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 26

legendary.name: Rend
entries: The shard makes one Telekinetic Rend attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The shard uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Commanding Thought (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The shard targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 20 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the end of its next turn. While charmed in this way, the target becomes the shard's puppet, acting and moving in accordance with its telepathic commands. While under the shard's control, the target can take only the Attack (shard chooses the target) or Dash action on its turn.

monsters.name: Draconic Spirit

ac.special: 14 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

hp.special: 50 + 10 for each spell level above 5th (the dragon has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to the level of the spell)

monsters.speed: walk 30 ft., fly 60 ft., swim 30 ft.

traits.name: Shared Resistances
entries: When you summon the dragon, choose one of its damage resistances. You have resistance to the chosen damage type until the spell ends.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes a number of Rend attacks equal to half the spell's level (rounded down), and it uses Breath Weapon.

actions.name: Rend
entries: mw your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 1d6 + 4 + summonSpellLevel piercing damage.

actions.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The dragon exhales destructive energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature takes 2d6 damage of a type this dragon has resistance to (your choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12
monsters.languages: Draconic, understands the languages you speak

monsters.name: Dragon Blessed

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The blessed makes two Mace or Radiant Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Mace
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Radiant Bolt
entries: rs 6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 22 (5d8) radiant damage, and the blessed regains 5 (1d10) hit points.

monsters.languages: Common, Draconic, and any two languages

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The chosen makes one Handaxe attack and two Shortsword attacks.

actions.name: Handaxe
entries: mw,rw 6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage. The handaxe magically returns to the chosen's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

actions.name: Shortsword
entries: mw 6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Dragon Speaker

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The speaker makes two Thunder Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Thunder Bolt
entries: ms,rs 5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. 13 (3d8) thunder damage, and the target is pushed horizontally up to 10 feet away from the speaker.

monsters.languages: Common, Draconic, and any two languages

traits.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Steam Breath 5
entries: The dragon turtle exhales steam in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

monsters.name: Dragonblood Ooze

traits.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
entries: The ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The ooze makes two Pseudopod attacks. The ooze can replace one Pseudopod attack with its Slime Breath, if available.

actions.name: Pseudopod
entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Slime Breath
entries: The ooze expels a spray of its gelatinous mass in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) acid damage and is pulled up to 30 feet straight toward the ooze. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 14
monsters.languages: understands Draconic and the languages of its creator but can't speak

monsters.name: Dragonbone Golem

traits.name: Fear Aura
entries: Each creature of the golem's choice that starts its turn within 20 feet of the golem must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw unless the golem is incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this golem's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes one Pinion attack and two Rend attacks.

actions.name: Pinion
entries: mw 9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is pinned beneath the bony pinion and restrained. The golem has two pinions, each of which can restrain one target. If a creature is restrained by one of the pinions, the golem can't attack with it. Any creature restrained by a pinion can free itself at the start of its turn with a successful 17 Strength (Athletics) check.

actions.name: Rend
entries: mw 9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Petrifying Breath 5
entries: The golem emits a 60-foot cone of petrifying gas from its mouth. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or take 35 (10d6) poison damage and be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the target. On a failed save, the target is petrified.

monsters.languages: understands Draconic and the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonborn makes three Longsword attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) radiant damage. The dragonborn can cause the sword to flare with bright light, and the target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of the dragonborn's next turn. The sword can flare in this way only once per turn.

actions.name: Healing Touch (1/Day)
entries: The dragonborn touches another creature within 5 feet of it. The target magically regains 40 hit points. In addition, all diseases and poisons affecting the target are removed.

actions.name: Radiant Breath
entries: The dragonborn exhales fiery radiance in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When the dragonborn uses this action, it can choose up to three creatures in the cone. These creatures take no damage from the radiance and instead regain 22 (4d10) hit points each.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Mental Defense
entries: While the dragonborn is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonborn makes three Mind Blade attacks.

actions.name: Mind Blade
entries: mw,rw 7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Heat Breath
entries: The dragonborn exhales a wave of intense heat in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Metal objects in that area glow red-hot until the end of the dragonborn's next turn. Any creature in physical contact with a heated object at the start of its turn must make a 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) fire damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonborn makes two Greataxe attacks.

actions.name: Greataxe
entries: mw 8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (1d12 + 5) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Necrotic Breath
entries: The dragonborn exhales shadowy fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage and is frightened of the dragonborn for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Dragonflesh Abomination

traits.name: Cloying Miasma
entries: The abomination is surrounded by a noxious stench. At the start of the abomination's turn, any creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the abomination's next turn.

traits.name: Regeneration
entries: The abomination regains 10 hit points at the start of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The abomination makes three attacks using Claw, Acidic Spit, or a combination of them. It can replace one of the attacks with a Tail attack.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

actions.name: Tail
entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Acidic Spit
entries: rw 5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 10 (3d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Acid Belch 5
entries: The abomination belches forth a cloud of acidic gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The grafter makes one Claw attack and one Greatclub attack.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

actions.name: Greatclub
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Acid Retch 5
entries: The grafter retches forth a spray of acidic bile in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Dragonnel

traits.name: Flyby
entries: The dragonnel doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonnel makes two Rend attacks.

actions.name: Rend
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 13
monsters.languages: understands Draconic and Common but can't speak

hp.special: 5 + five times your ranger level (the drake has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to your ranger level)

traits.name: Draconic Essence
entries: When you summon the drake, choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. The chosen type determines the drake's damage immunity and the damage of its Infused Strikes trait.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 3 plus PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1d6 plus PB piercing damage.

traits.name: Amphibious
entries: The egg hunter can breathe air and water.

traits.name: False Appearance
entries: If the egg hunter is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the egg hunter move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the egg hunter is animate. Dragons have disadvantage on this check.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The egg hunter makes two Barbed Proboscis attacks, and it can use Torpor Spores if it's available.

actions.name: Barbed Proboscis
entries: mw 8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the egg hunter regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

actions.name: Torpor Spores 5
entries: The egg hunter releases a billow of sparkling blue spores. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on the egg hunter must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn but not both, and it can't take reactions. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this egg hunter's Torpor Spores for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Amphibious
entries: The egg hunter can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The egg hunter makes two Egg Tooth attacks.

actions.name: Egg Tooth
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 17 (4d6 + 3) piercing damage if the target is an object.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster
entries: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The dragon doesn't require air or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes one Bite attack, two Claw attacks, and one Tentacle attack.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (1d6 + 8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tentacle
entries: mw 15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. 12 (1d8 + 8) psychic damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, it is grappled (escape 18). The dragon can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

actions.name: Tadpole Brine Breath 5
entries: The dragon exhales brine in a 120-foot line that is 15 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a success or failure, if the creature isn't a Construct or an Undead, it becomes infested with illithid tadpoles.

While infested, the creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves. If the creature is targeted by magic that ends a curse or restores 40 hit points or more, the tadpoles infesting the creature are killed instantly, ending the effect on the creature.

If a Humanoid is reduced to 0 hit points while infested, the creature is stable but remains unconscious for 6d12 hours. When the period of unconsciousness ends, the creature transforms into a mind flayer (see the Monster Manual) with all its hit points. Casting a wish spell on the unconscious creature rids it of the infestation and prevents it from turning into a mind flayer.

legendary.name: Tentacle
entries: The dragon makes one Tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Shatter Concentration (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon targets a creature it is grappling. The target's concentration on a spell it has cast or an ability it is maintaining ends, and the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage.

monsters.name: Emerald Dragon Wyrmling
monsters.speed: walk 30 ft., fly 60 ft., burrow 20 ft.

traits.name: Tunneler
entries: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and can leave a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Disorienting Breath 5
entries: The dragon exhales a wave of psychic dissonance in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 (5d6) psychic damage, and until the end of its next turn, when the creature makes an attack roll or an ability check, it must roll a d4 and reduce the total by the number rolled. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15

monsters.name: Emerald Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: walk 60 ft., fly [object Object] ft., swim 60 ft., burrow 60 ft.

traits.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 19) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Breath Weapon 5
entries: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Claw attack.

legendary.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Psychic Beam (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm emits a beam of psychic energy in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The eyedrake doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Antimagic Breath
entries: The eyedrake emits a magic wave in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 39 (6d12) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Every spell of 3rd level or lower ends on creatures and objects of the eyedrake's choice in that area.

actions.name: Eye Rays
entries: The eyedrake shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), each ray targeting one creature it can see within 60 feet of it:

monsters.name: Gem Stalker

traits.name: Spider Climb
entries: The gem stalker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The gem stalker doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The gem stalker makes four Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monsters.languages: telepathy 60 ft. understands Draconic but can't speak

monsters.name: Ghost Dragon

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost dragon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain||3. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the ghost dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The ghost dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghost dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 32 (6d8 + 5) cold damage, and the target's speed is halved until the start of the dragon's next turn.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Terrifying Breath
entries: The ghost dragon exhales shadowy mist in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 21 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 40 (9d8) cold damage and is frightened of the ghost dragon for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened.
While frightened of the ghost dragon, a creature is paralyzed. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this ghost dragon's Terrifying Breath for the next 24 hours.

monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 24

actions.name: Peck
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Gold Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: walk 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft., burrow 60 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
entries: mw 18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

entries: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:

actions.name: Change Shape
entries: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monsters.name: Green Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: walk 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft., burrow 60 ft.

traits.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
entries: mw 18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon 5
entries: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 78 (12d12) poison damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Arcane Spear (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The greatwyrm creates four spears of magical force. Each spear hits a creature of the greatwyrm's choice it can see within 120 feet of it, dealing 12 (1d8 + 8) force damage to its target, then disappears.

traits.name: False Appearance (Hoard Form Only)
entries: If the mimic is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the mimic move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the mimic is animate.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The mimic makes one Bite attack and two Pseudopod attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Pseudopod
entries: mw 8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the mimic adheres to the target. A creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

actions.name: Caustic Mist 5
entries: The mimic sprays a fine mist of acid in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 27 (6d8) acid damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

actions.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mimic transforms into a hoard or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monsters.name: Hoard Scarab
monsters.speed: walk 20 ft., fly 20 ft., burrow 20 ft.

traits.name: False Appearance
entries: If the scarab is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the scarab move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the scarab is animate.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 9

monsters.name: Hollow Dragon

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the hollow dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Reconstruction
entries: When the hollow dragon is reduced to 0 hit points, its body breaks into nine pieces: two arms, two legs, two wings, a tail, a torso, and a head. Each piece is a Large object with AC 19, 27 hit points, and immunity to psychic and poison damage. After 1d6 days, if all pieces are still within 6 miles of each other, they all teleport to the location of the head piece and merge with it, whereupon the hollow dragon regains all its hit points and becomes active again.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The hollow dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, and it can use Sapping Presence.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Sapping Presence
entries: Each creature of the hollow dragon's choice within 60 feet of it must make a 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's speed is halved and it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this hollow dragon's Sapping Presence for 24 hours.

actions.name: Radiant Breath 5
entries: The hollow dragon exhales radiant flames in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 23

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The hollow dragon makes one Claw attack.

legendary.name: Ghostly Binding (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The hollow dragon creates ethereal bindings around a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 19 Strength saving throw or be restrained until the end of the dragon's next turn.

legendary.name: Booming Scales (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: A sudden loud ringing noise, painfully intense, erupts from the hollow dragon's frame. Each creature within 10 feet of the hollow dragon must make a 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The liondrake makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Blood-Chilling Roar 4
entries: The liondrake lets out a terrifying roar audible out to 300 feet. Any creature within 30 feet of the liondrake that can hear its roar must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the liondrake for 1 minute. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is also paralyzed for the same duration. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this liondrake's Blood-Chilling Roar for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Immutable Form
entries: The peacekeeper is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: While the peacekeeper is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The peacekeeper makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (3d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Calming Mist 5
entries: The peacekeeper releases a calming gas in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 14 Charisma saving throw or become charmed by the peacekeeper for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0.

monsters.name: Metallic Warbler

traits.name: Immutable Form
entries: The warbler is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: While the warbler is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

actions.name: Claw
entries: mw 4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Calming Mist 5
entries: The warbler releases a calming gas in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 11 Charisma saving throw or become charmed by the warbler for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0.

monsters.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

monsters.name: Moonstone Dragon Wyrmling

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

monsters.speed: walk 30 ft., fly 60 ft., burrow 15 ft.

traits.name: Spider Climb
entries: The dragon can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Tunneler
entries: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and can leave a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Bite
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) thunder damage.

actions.name: Debilitating Breath 5
entries: The dragon exhales a pulse of high-pitched, nearly inaudible sound in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) thunder damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

traits.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny scarab. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Swarm of Bites
entries: mw 5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage if the swarm is at half of its hit points or fewer, and the target has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. 22 (4d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the sea serpent can't constrict another target.

entries: mw 7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away and knocked prone.

entries: The sea serpent exhales a 30-foot cone of cold. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 38 (7d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: The dragon exhales yellowish necrotic energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Constitution saving throw.
